thread.title: Britain awards £2.4 billion in submarine work to BAE Systems

title: Britain awards £2.4 billion in submarine work to BAE Systems
text:
May 14, 2018 / 9:47 AM / Updated 8 hours ago Britain awards £2.4 billion in submarine work to BAE Systems Reuters Staff 1 Britain on Monday awarded defence firm BAE Systems ( BAES.L ) 2.4 billion pounds to work on two submarine programmes, the company said in a statement. FILE PHOTO: A BAE systems sign is seen outside the company's Warton site near Preston, northern England, October 1, 2009. REUTERS/Phil Noble/File Photo
The Ministry of Defence gave BAE a 1.5 billion pound contract for delivery of the seventh Astute class submarine, and a further 900 million pounds for the next phase of the Dreadnought submarine programme, the company said. Reporting by Alistair Smout; editing by Kate Holton
